result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin E. Bruns was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex with Child Age 16 or Older, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.09.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: --To pay statutory costs, fees and surcharges, including DNA Surcharge

--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--Maintain absolute sobriety (no alcohol, no controlled substances without a valid prescription, take all prescribed medications as prescribed)
--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--To undergo any other type of assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
--No contact with CBB (dob: 7/28/1996). No presence at or near CBB's residence, school or employment, unless both she and his agent agree

Arresting Agency: JCSD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Sex with Child Age 16 or Older
charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kevin E. Bruns

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: with attached victim restitution request form(s)

Cases 15CF234 & 15CM258 called together at 2:20 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Kevin E. Bruns in court with Attorney Corey Chirafisi. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

15CF234: Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Mr. Bruns waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Arraignment.
State files information; Arraignment:--service of Information admitted, reading waived--maximum penalties recited

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered on Charge in 15CF234 & 15CM258; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
ADA Hall submits victim impact statement


15CM258, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 2 years, concurrent, with conditions:
15CF234, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 3 years, concurrent, with conditions:
--serve 4 months in Jefferson County Jail, (15CF234 only) with Huber/Work-release privileges; to commence forthwith
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--Sex offender registration under 973.048 to expire upon successful completion of probation (15CF234)
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--Maintain absolute sobriety (no alcohol, no controlled substances without a valid prescription, take all prescribed medications as prescribed)
--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--To undergo any other type of assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two
--To pay statutory costs, fees and surcharges, including DNA Surcharge
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
--To pay restitution of $70, joint and several (15CF234)
--To pay 10% restitution processing fee
--No contact with CBB (dob: 7/28/1996). No presence at or near CBB's residence, school or employment, unless both she and his agent agree

Days credit for time already served: 0 days
Felony Firearm/Voting Prohibitions Warnings Form Given
Court finds that society will not be harmed and the defendant would benefit and grants expungement on 15CF234 upon successful completion of probation under 973.015.
Recess: 3:05 pm
for continuance of the 1/5/16 plea/sentencing to 2:00 pm the same date
Proposed stip and order for continuance

Cases 15CF234 and 15CM258 called together at 9:56am [mo]
Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for Branch IV
Defendant Kevin E. Bruns in court with Attorney Corey Chirafisi.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty. Chirafissi gives a case synopsis; requests a Plea/Sentencing date in early January.
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling. 
recess:9:59am

NEXT: FOR BOTH CASES: Plea/Sentencing on 1/5/16 at 8:30am
Proposed Stipulation & Order for Continuance of 10/30/15 Status Conference

Cases 15CF234 & 15CM258 called together at 9:47 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Kevin E. Bruns in court with Attorney Corey Chirafisi. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

15CF324:
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived upon agreement of parties 

15CM258:
Service of the complaint admitted; reading waived
Plea of Not Guilty entered; Speedy Trial waived by Defendant

Court requires a $5000 signature bond, TO COVER BOTH FILES, with conditions:
-Absolute sobriety
-No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores 
-No acts or threats of violence towards any persons 
-No contact with CBB (dob: 7/28/1996) 
-Booking at JCSD 
Recess: 9:51 am

NEXT: BOTH CASES: (1) DA Pre-trial Conference scheduled for 10/7/15 at 2:00 pm - Send notices (2) STC scheduled for at 10/30/15 at 2:30 pm - Send notices
